org.xlattice.httpd.sitemaker

Class SiteConfigurer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xlattice.httpd.sitemaker.SiteConfigurer

  • public class SiteConfigurer
extends java.lang.Object
    Converts between a site configuration file in XML form and its object representation. In its current incarnation, the configuration file is an XML file following this form: 
       <siteconfig>
     <nodeinfo dir="DIRNAME" master="MASTER_NAME"
                                nodekey = "NODE_DOMAIN_NAME />
     <sites>
       <site> name="SITE_A" dir="DIR_A"/>
       <site> name="SITE_B" dir="DIR_B"/>
       <site> name="SITE_C" dir="DIR_C"/>
       ...
     </sites>
     <output dir="dirName"/>
  </siteconfig>
    The nodeinfo line is mapped into a NodeInfo object. Each of the site lines maps into a SiteInfo object, giving its fully qualified domain name (like www.xlattice.org) and the directory where the Web site's files are to be found. The output line specifies where the generated Web site is to be written. After SiteMaker is invoked, the output directory will contain an xlattice/ subdirectory.
    Author:
    Jim Dixon
